intro: Symplocos martinicensis subsp. jamaicensis, commonly known as Jamaican wax myrtle, is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain several seeds, typical of the genus Symplocos. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
